thread.title: Blackhawks put Bickell on waivers: Source
thread.title_full: Blackhawks put Bickell on waivers: Source

title: Blackhawks put Bickell on waivers: Source
text:
‘Ridiculous’ turn of events in Kane investigation: Lawyer 
A person familiar with the move tells The Associated Press that the Chicago Blackhawks have placed high-priced forward Bryan Bickell on waivers. 
The person spoke on the condition of anonymity because the Blackhawks did not include Bickell as part of their roster moves Friday. 
In making the move, the Blackhawks free up $4 million that Bickell's contract represents against their salary cap. 
Bickell is a rugged forward who was the focus of trade speculation this summer. Bickell signed a four-year, $16 million contract after helping Chicago win the Stanley Cup championship in 2013. 
His production dropped off last year when he finished with 14 goals and 28 points in 80 games. Bickell experienced vertigo, which forced him to miss most of Chicago's Stanley Cup final series against Tampa Bay. Sponsored Links
